Hi Barry -- The technique is called 'yakite shitate' and involves the 
tsub=
a to be placed into the furnace until the surface slightly 
melts.  This pr=
oduces a glaze like finish.  It's most remembered in 
the kanayama school p=
ieces but used in others.

s" <warlord@...> wrote:
>
> Alan and Blokes 'n' Sheilas,
> 
> "Glazed surfa=
ce".  Now that's interesting.  How was the glaze 
produced??  For
> such a =
feature to have lasted a few centuries it must be very hard, 
which
> sugge=
sts to me that it was produced by heating the tsuba in a 
furnace to induce=

> an oxidation on the surface that became "the glaze".  If chemically 
ind=
uced it
> would show wear, surely.  Just some mild speculation over my 
bre=
akfast oats...
> 
> Barry Thomas.
